Ich habe mir dieses Headset gekauft, da mich schon länger das Kabel an meinem alten Headset gestört hat. Für die Lesefaulen: eine Pro und Contra Liste. Weiter unten gibt's das Ganze dann in ausführlich :) Pro + Guter Klang + Sehr einfache Einrichtung + Macht für den Preis einen wertigen Eindruck + Sehr Weich um die Ohren (Langes tragen war kein Problem) + klappbar, daher platzsparend + Reichweite ist gut. Habe 8-10 Meter gemessen. (Kommt auch durch Wände ohne Stahlbeton) Contra - Riecht anfangs etwas nach Chemie, verfliegt aber schnell - Habe zuerst ein "Montagsprodukt" erhalten. Der Verkäufer hat aber sofort reagiert, war sehr freundlich und hat ein neues zugeschickt, welches funktionierte Beim Auspacken macht das Headset einen wertigen Eindruck. Es kam in einem schlichten aber gut verpackten Karton, der im Paket war. Es war stoßsicher in Luftpolster-Folie eingewickelt, was ich sehr gut fand, da bei Hartplastikverpackungen sonst immer soviel Plastik verschwendet wird. Das Pairing ist denkbar einfach gewesen. Knopf lange gedrückt halten, das Headset geht an. Nochmal gedrückt halten und das Headset geht in den Pairing Mode. Nur noch am Rechner auswählen und zack! Funktionierte... nicht lange! Der Kontakt brach nach ein paar Minuten leider immer wieder ab und Audio war nur noch abgehakt zu hören. Nach kurzem Mail-Verkehr mit dem Verkäufer habe ich sofort ein neues zugeschickt bekommen. Bei dem trat der Fehler nicht auf. Produktionsfehler passieren jedem Hersteller. Umso besser fand ich die schnelle Reaktionszeit des Verkäufers. Die Audioqualität ist für den Preis meiner Meinung nach gut. Auch der Tragekomfort ist super. Ich habe es jetzt mehrere Tage jeweils viele Stunden getragen und keine Kopfschmerzen bekommen. Es drückt nicht und wird auch nicht unangenehm. Einzig der anfängliche Geruch nach Chemie hat mich etwas gestört. Verflog aber schon nach zwei Tagen. Fazit: Ich bin super zufrieden mit dem Headset und fand die schnelle Reaktionszeit des Verkäufers wirklich gut! Wer ein günstiges Headset mit gutem Klang sucht und dann auch noch auf Service wert legt, dem kann ich dieses Teil hier nur empfehlen.

Llevo usándolos casi 2 meses y he de decir que son buenos auriculares e ideales para los que somos amantes del sonido y la comunicación. Son ideales para ver televisión y escuchar música con el móvil, entre muchas otras actividades. El sonido es muy nítido, no he escuchado ni interferencias, ni ruidos extraños. Son excelentes al reproducir altos y bajos, incluso, puedes escuchar hasta los sonidos más bajos como el de la caída de un alfiler. Son grandes pero cómodos gracias a su diadema que se adapta al tamaño de la cabeza y a las almohadillas para las orejas que son bastante cómodas y suaves al tacto. El material se percibe bueno ya que están realizados con acero inoxidable por lo que tendrás audífonos para rato. Otro aspecto que destacaría es la larga duración de su batería, ya que puedes utilizarlos por más de 20 horas de manera continua e inclusive tener largas conversaciones de unas 15 horas. Cuando la batería se agota podemos cargarlo con el cable USB que trabaja como cargador y que viene con los auriculares. Otra característica es que se pueden plegar haciendo que ocupen menos espacio a la hora de guardarlos. Además trae una funda para protegerlos cuando los guardas. Considero que ha sido una buena compra, calidad/precio.

Die Kopfhörer sind für das Geld einfach nicht zu toppen. Die Optik ist toll, sie sehen sehr hochwertig verarbeitet aus und fühlen sich auch so an. Die Gelenke lassen sich ohne Probleme bedienen und hinterlassen einen guten Eindruck. Der Klang überzeugt auf ganzer Linie. Mehr muss man dazu nicht sagen. Wer in diesem Preissegment kauft kann keinen Bose Klang erwarten. Der Akku hält gefühlt ewig, das hat mich am meisten überrascht. Das Koppeln funktioniert ebenfalls ohne Probleme. Unser Sohn (12) ist damit total happy. Ich würde sie jederzeit wieder kaufen und kann sie ohne Abstriche weiterempfehlen. der Klang ist für einen Kopfhörer dieser Preisklasse sehr gut. Glaube kaum, dass ein Hörer für 200 oder mehr € beim Hören von ohnehin komprimierten MP3-Dateien viel besser sein kann. Uneingeschränkte Kaufempfehlung.

Super! Der Kopfhörer passt perfekt und ist super bequem, auch nach langem tragen. Er schirmt die Umgebungsgeräusche gut raus. Die Tonqualität ist prima und die Verbindung mit Bluetooth klappt auch ohne Probleme (iPhone X). Kann ihn nur empfehlen
Prompte Lieferung. Der Sound ist einzigartig. Tragen sich absolut angenehm und sind sehr leicht, man spürt sie kaum. Ich würde sie jeder Zeit wieder kaufen.

Prinzipiell waren wir lange mit dem Gerät sehr zufrieden: - Sound über Bluetooth OK - guter Tragekomfort - die Freisprechfunktion wurde kaum genutzt, hat aber funktioniert Nach einem halben Jahr ist der Bedienungsknopf abgefallen, was noch mit etwas Pattex geklebt werden konnte. 4 Monate danach traten Risse im Bügel auf was wenig später zum Bruch geführt hätte, wenn ich den Bügel nicht mit einem Blech verstärkt hätte. 1 Monat danach traten die selben Risse auf der anderen Seite des Bügels auf. Dies ist auf die Form des Bügels zurück zu führen und m.E. ein Konstruktionsfehler. Schließlich ist nun der USB Stecker kaputt gegangen, sodass der Kopfhörer nicht mehr geladen werden kann (hier enden meine Reparaturkünste). Nun wird er nur noch über das beiliegende Kabel genutzt. Ich habe viel Geduld und guten Willen gezeigt und möchte darum meine Erfahrungen weiter geben. Schade dass das an sich gute Gerät, bei uns nicht mehr als ein Jahr durchgehalten hat - das ist einfach zu wenig für eine bessere Bewertung.

Die Kopfhörer machen einen hochwertigen Eindruck schon beim Auspacken. Wenn man sie dann in den Händen hält bestätigt sich der erste Eindruck. Der Klang sowie die Lautstärke sind meiner persönlichen Meinung nach sehr gut. Die Verbindung zum Handy war ebenfalls problemlos. Telefonieren über die Kopfhörer funktioniert einwandfrei. Alles in allem hätte ich mir für den Preis nichts besseres aussuchen können. Absolut empfehlenswert!!!

Bought these as an impulse purchase, but not regretted it. Day they arrived I fully charged them, then gave them a full rigourous test as I went about my daily routine, going to and from work, as well as completing errands, used them for about 3 hours solid. They connected to my phone almost instantly, sound quality is excellent, apart from the odd little jump in the music track, but that is common with any Bluetooth connection, so not really an issue. I was able to wear them the entire time comfortably, no soreness of the ears or discomfort, the buttons on the headphones made it much easier to skip a music track I didn't feel like listening to, as opposed to pulling out my phone every time to click the screen. Even after three hours of continuous use, the battery is still fairly full, so can easily get much more use out of them before they need another charge. All in all, a very good product for what you get, and an absolute steal at their current price!

I got these after being recommended them by a friend and I've been using them for three months now. They arrived on time in the case with an aux cord and instructions. The two major positives are the battery life and Bluetooth. With a full charge and constant usage, these last around 6-8 hours. When I turn them off when I'm not using them, they last the full day. I've had no issues connecting with Bluetooth whatsoever and the range isn't too bad either. I can go into the next room without them disconnecting. The sound quality is also okay for the price. However, here are some major flaws of this product. 1) About two weeks into using this headphones, one of the volume buttons broke. I thought it was my own doing but two of friends who own the exact same pair of headphones had this problem too. 2) The sound leakage is almost amusing. I wasn't expecting to have no sound leakage but someone was able to hear my music and podcasts while they were sitting across from me. The headphones were on my head, over my ears at mid-volume. 3) With the Aux cord, the quality of sound can be very iffy. It was fine on my laptop but with computers and my phone, the sound was distorted and quite echoey. When watching videos, the audio would be sometimes out of sync with the images on screen. 4) Unsurprisingly, the Aux cord broke after 5 days. 5) After a while, the build starts feel a bit flimsy. I have to adjust them now every time when I use them. My sibling got a pair of headphones a few weeks ago. They were suspiciously exactly the same build, shape and size as these headphones. They even have similar Bluetooth names and same "Power off" voice. The only difference was the brand name. She didn't get a case and got hers for £7 less. If the case isn't so much of a necessity, then you can find cheaper alternatives. All in all, these headphones aren't awful but its quality is questionable.

I wear it on the biggest length and fits on my head well. Even though the headscarf, I can hear the music pretty loud It comes with a hard storage case which I am actually very grateful for because otherwise I would have had to purchase a separate one. The case is rather bulky in my rucksack but the headphones fit inside well a d protects it which is the important thing. If the case was soft then it might be better. After using my headphones so often, all the letters and symbols have since worn off on the buttons on the side. I think they shouldn't have so many buttons in the first place because even I get confused by them and end up either skipping a song when I want to repeat it, or changing to radio by accident. I also have to charge it every 2 days, which the battery life was a little longer. Still, as a student this is affordable and had lasted me this long that maybe beats wouldn't be able to do, haha!

Really nice Bluetooth headphones. I waited a while to review these to see if they really would last longer than regular head phones... Bought for my 9 year old daughter because I was sick of constantly buying new headphones due to the wire breaking or coming away so we decided to try a Bluetooth set.... They are fab. They are hardy and lightweight. They have a built in fm radio, unfortunately we are not in a good reception area for this, but I imagine if you are this would be such a neat feature. Super easy and simple to control with just a few buttons on the side. A couple of hours to charge to the maximum and they will last my daughter a good few evenings before needing charging again. It also took just seconds to connect and they were good to go. Highly recommended.

It's NOT over the ear as it is sold. So that was a unpreasant surprise when I unpacked it! But that being said, I am a ha[ppy customer after all, because the headphone is comfortable to wear, although on the ear and not over the ear. And it does have a nice sound. I am a bass lover and for the bass is good and teh overal sound is nice for the money. So I am a happy customer after all. I like the soft cover too that comes with it, only I don't like the hook that it has. It does not close properly when not in use or also when in use. But apart from that, I like it. The wire that comes with is also handy when the phone does not have battery life anymore (and that happens often as the battery is not that good...) I am using the headphone for the gym and for that purpose I also use the micro-sd functionality and that works great! Now I don't need to bring my phone to the gym! I would certainly recommend it! Nice sound! 4* because I am happy with it, but it is not "over the ear" as stated in the title, it is ON EAR! (and I don't have big ears)

No good.broken after a month (cannot charge as connection broken) and dubious sound quality for first month anyway, also started losing charge very quickly. Spend your money on better quality headphones...just to update this the company have refunded my purchase so can’t fault them for that. They responded speedily and were really helpful. 5star customer service but I’m sorry I can’t bump up the stars for the product rating ☹️

Der Kopfhörer ist super, wenn man einfach mal alles ausblenden möchte. Selbst ohne Musik oder Hörbuch merkt man, dass er die Umgebungsgeräusche dämpft, der Bass ist stark. Allerdings sollte man in anfangs 1-2 Tage auslüften, er riecht ziemlich unangenehm nach Plastik. (den Fabrikarbeitern zuliebe würde ich auch 10€ mehr zahlen, der Köpfhörer selbst wäre das allemal wert. -2 Sterne für das schlechte Gewissen ihnen gegenüber)

The headphones fold up neatly and come included with a case, usb charger cable and additional cable for connecting directly into a device. I would’ve preferred longer cables but it’s not a big deal. The headphones are very comfortable and are padded with soft lining inside. The sound is impressive too, I actually prefer it to my Sony pair which cost over £250! I bought this pair for my son and he absolutely loves them. He really likes the colour too as it matches the kids fire HD Kindle he got for Christmas. The only downside is the charging. It does let you know when the battery is low by sounding a “beep” in your ear but you have to charge it straight away. There’s also a red light which appears whilst charging and it goes off once it’s fully charged. An indicator would be really good so you know exactly how low the battery actually is. Apart from that, I would highly recommend and it’s a great gift idea for kids with devices (or adults) 😁

They’re really flimsy at the joints and just snapped, I don’t like them, luckily I had another pair of cheaper better ones, I can’t remember what they’re called but there’s a pair of Bluetooth headphones that are red and black, Cost maybe £15 on here, qualities the same, and they’re less flimsy. Don’t waste your money.

Purchase (Oct) Charge via USB port. I changed it on Thursday and its still going on moderate use and its now Saturday.... Sunday (Sunday). Buttons are a little fiddly to use and I often press the wrong button when trying to increase /decrease the sound or turn the device on or off. Radio works when it wants to. If syncing to more than one device make sure to turn off items already synced or it won't connect to anything new. Comes in a handy semi hard pouch with a zip. Headphones collapse to enable them to fold. Be careful not to bend at the wrong point as that could break them. A bit flimsy at the best of times but more so when extended. I tend to shorten back and then fold to put away. Comfortable to wear, lightweight. Bought for mother who is still getting to grips with the controls. Nice subtle shade of gold. Update Dec: 07.12.19 Mother doesn't like them. So I'm using them. I've gotten use to the controls now but the radio function remains a mystery to me. Callers or those I call report an irritating echo and poor sound. From my prospective there wasn't much of a problem but I had to revert to turning off the headset to continue the calls. Music sounds relatively good to me, clear but an equaliser would help. When used for my language app it does not pick up, only says the Last word at best. By chance this morning I was listening to music and then put the language app on and it transmitted the full sentences or the words being taught.... Bizarre! Does this mean I have to have my music on in order to hear my language lessons? 🤔 Shouldn't be! I have purchased 2 other headphones and the above problems are not there. Yet to use as call receiver or maker. All in the same price bracket.

👍 légers et ergonomiques. 👍 Très bonne tenue dans les oreilles : ne ressortent pas même lorsque je suis en mouvement . 👍 Puissants et discrets : j'ai été agréablement surpris par la qualité du son resituée (notamment celle des basses) au regard de leur petite taille. 👍 Tactile fonctionne très bien. 👍 L'isolation : La technologie de supression de bruit fonctionne remarquablement bien, si bien qu'une fois dans l'oreille , on est très bien isolé de l'environnement extérieur. 👍 L'étui : ✔️ vraiment bien travaillé, comme vous pouvez le voir sur ma vidéo , la fermeture est magnétique, très pratique. ✔️ Je les utilise depuis environ 1 mois et je n'ai toujours pas eu à recharger l'étui. ✔️ La zone d'insertion des écouteurs dans l'étui est également magnétique : rien qu'en les posant ils sont comme aspirés et tiennent très fermement même lorsqu'on agite l'étui. ✔️ Possibilité de l'utiliser comme batterie de secours (chargé à 100 % il pourra charger a moitié une batterie de téléphone). ✔️ Niveau de charge indiqué en %. ✔️ Housse de transport : pratique pour ne pas rayer l'étui. 👍 Appariement rapide des 2 écouteurs : si jamais il n'y en a qu'un seul qui fonctionne , il faut les réinsérer dans l'étui et les ressortir , ça les resynchronisera. 👍 L'autonomie : quasiment infinie puisque avec ce type d'écouteurs , le fait de les ranger entre 2 trajets par exemple , les recharge en même temps , et sachant que l'étui a une très bonne capacité et bien ils sont chargés en permanence et donc jamais les écouteurs ne se déchargent ( a condition de charger son étui une fois de temps en temps). 👍 Possibilité d'utiliser un écouteur ou 2 : en ne retirant qu'un seul de l'étui seulement celui-ci fonctionnera , l'autre restera en veille. Point négatif 🙄 (sans ça le produit serait parfait en tout point) : 👎 ils clignotent ALTERNATIVEMENT, LENTEMENT et PROGRESSIVEMENT en intensité , lorsqu'une musique est en cours de lecture : un peu tape à l'oeil la nuit ... Ça apporte un effet un peu gadget (tout dépend de la personne , moi ça me gênait un peu). Nb : sur ma vidéo on les voit clignoter non pas comme je viens de le décrire car je ne pouvais pas jouer de la musique en même temps que je filmais. Par contre lorsqu'on parle au tel avec , ou qu'on ne joue aucune musique , ça clignote comme sur la vidéo. Voilà donc je note ce produit 4.5 étoiles car il est vraiment très bon , la demi étoile c'est pour le clignotement des LEDs des écouteurs. mais comme ce n'est pas possible sur Amazon je note donc 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟 (je serais un peu trop sévère si je consacrais une étoile entière à ce point particulier), surtout qu'on parle d'un produit à 40 euros !. J'espère que mon retour d'expérience vous sera utile et vous guidera dans votre choix 😁.

Bonjour Je viens de recevoir mais écouteurs. Première impression l’ensemble respire la qualité et la solidité. Dans la boite vous trouverez. -une notice en français et très bien expliqué. -les 2 oreillettes (écouteurs) -la boites de rechargement -un filet pour le transport -des embouts pour les oreilles -un câble de rechargement Une fois connecté le son est très bon et très agréable (aucun grésillement). Les écouteurs son tactiles et très réactif au touché. Pour prendre un appel téléphonique il suffit tout simplement d’appuyer brièvement sur l’une des 2 oreillettes et pour raccrocher appuyer 2 fois. Il y a un petit temps d’adaptation mais cela vient très très rapidement. Une fois les oreillettes déposées sur le socle elle se recharge toute seul, on n’a rien à faire. Le petit plus est que la boite de chargement peut servir également pour recharger son smartphone. Pour conclure : Très bon produit.

Écouteurs sans fil de qualité. Ils sont design et élégants. La boîte de chargement est très belle et les matériaux sont de qualité. Les écouteurs remplissent bien leur rôle, la musique et les appels téléphoniques sont de très bonne qualité. On peut décrocher ou raccrocher depuis les écouteurs. De la même manière, il est possible de gérer la musique depuis les écouteurs. Autre point important, les écouteurs tiennent bien en place dans les oreilles. Des coussinets de différentes tailles sont livrés avec les écouteurs, ce qui permet de trouver la taille adaptée à ses oreilles. Bref, produit bien fini, joli et très pratique.

Produit de qualité. Les écouteurs tiennent bien dans les oreilles. Ils ne gardent pas la chaleur. La connexion Bluetooth se fait toute seule. Très agréable. La qualité du son est super bonne. Je suis super content du rapport qualité prix. Je recommande.

On m'avait offert des écouteurs sans fils de marque à Noël passé, mais pas comme ceux-ci car un fil reliait les deux écouteurs. La personne me les ayant offert pensait bien en m'offrant des écouteurs de marque, et je le comprends, mais 1 an plus tard, la batterie est HS et les écouteurs ne tiennent pas la charge. Obligé d'écouter avec le câble usb branché en permanence, pratique pour des écouteurs sans fil. Du coup j'en ai profité pour acheter des écouteurs plus sophistiqués et inspirés de tous les écouteurs récents (comme les AirPods). Je ne suis pas déçu du tout. Le petit boîtier permettant de transporter les écouteurs est compacte et fait office de batterie. Je n'ai pas eu besoin de recharger le socle une seule fois depuis que j'ai les écouteurs. Le son est bon, sans être exceptionnel. Ce sont des écouteurs et non un casque à plusieurs centaines d'euros. Largement suffisant pour mon usage et pour écouter mes podcasts le soir dans le lit ou dans les transports. Ils sont très discrets et tiennent bien en place. Le socle est aimanté de qui permet de pouvoir remettre les écouteurs en place les yeux fermés (pratique la nuit). Seul bémol, ils émettent une lumière en permanence, qui est certe légère, mais tout de même dérangeante pour le partenaire la nuit.

Firsts of all... the packaging of the product is neat and well thought out, including a small pouch to store your charging pod while you carry your earbuds around. The appearance of the earbuds and charging pod is modern and sleek with a digital display showing the battery life of the pod. Upon first using the earbuds to listen to music my first impression is that they have a very high quality of sound with impressive bass, the earbuds have excellent noise cancellation allowing you to fully experience the full affects of the sound quality. After using for a range of activities including the hands free phone call feature, listening to audiobooks and music the battery life remained well above my expectations and when both pods were placed in the charging pod they both charged back up to 100% within the hour. Overall I would rate these earbuds a 5/5 for sound quality, comfort, ease of use and battery life.

Ich habe richtig Pech mit solchen Kopfhörern. Die einen wurden mir geklaut und die nächsten habe ich fallengelassen und dann sind sie überfahren worden. Trotzdem finde ich das Konzept richtig toll und musste mir wieder weitere bestellen. Jetzt muss ich wieder begeistert sagen, dass wir bei der nächsten Generation von Bluetooth-Kopfhörern angelangt sind. Das Design gefällt mir richtig gut. Die Beleuchtung sieht stylish aus und die Passform ist großartig (für meine Ohren). Nach anfänglicher Enttäuschung über Tonqualität und wie die Kopfhörer ins Ohr passen, habe ich andere Aufsätze ausprobiert, die mitgeliefert wurden. Die sahen etwas komisch aus, aber es waren tatsächlich die Perfekten dabei. Wenn die Hörer richtig ins Ohr passen, so ist die Tonqualität der Wahnsinn. Tiefe Bässe und klare Höhen. Einfach unfassbar, wenn man sich vorstellt, was die Teile kosten. Die Sprachqualität ist auch toll. Alle Leute, mit denen ich telefoniert habe, haben nichts davon gemerkt, dass ich nicht normal über das Telefon telefoniere. Die Verbindung ist sehr stabil, auch über viele Meter hinweg. Das Highlight ist die Touch-Steuerung mit Multi-Tap-Gesten um Play/Pause, Vorheriger/Nächster Song oder sogar die Gerätelautstärke zu ändern.

I liked the look of AirPods but not the price so decided to try these. They last a v long time before needing recharged (never timed) LED digital display smart digital screen showing charge percentage is very good Works via Bluetooth & extremely easy to setup. Box contains all you need to get started, even 4 sets of silicone earplugs. Comfortable to wear and superb sound quality.

I bought these headphones for exercising as my current headphones (which are really good quality Bose) are wired for their noise cancelling feature – this isn’t ideal in the gym or when out for a run. I’ve done a short video showing what is included in the box and how it looks, however I had to cut it short to actually test the ear pods out! The sound quality is good for the price, I find that if I turn the volume up to 100% on my iPhone it is very flat in terms of bass, however at 50% it is great. The reality is that we shouldn’t need our volume up to 100% with in-ear headphones, so it isn’t an issue. The ear pods are easy to connect and do so almost instantly if they have already been paired with a device. The charge lasts well and I absolutely love the box that they come in – check out the video review. All in all for the price these are a nice pair of ear pods - Happy Dad

These little gems are so wonderful. From the sound quality to the battery life, I have ZERO complaints! They also weren't too big (thank god) because that was my only concern. If you are contemplating if you should get this or the million similar products on the site, then let me help- DO IT! BUY THIS ONE! YOU WONT REGRET IT. (You're welcome).

Acquistando questi auricolari noterete subito il suo design elegante e compatto dal peso irrisorio. La confezione contiene auricolari,cavo di ricarica, manuale, custodia per ricarica, sacchettino e gommini di varie misure. Abbiamo la possibilità di collegarli tramite il Bluetooth a diversi dispositivi e sono impermeabili IP65. Ho testato il prodotto facendo running e posso assicurarvi che sono veramente comodi.

My son wanted AirPods but there were to pricey so I bought these instead after buying a similar pair a couple of weeks ago for my husband. My son is always on the phone to his mates or listening to music from Spotify and I liked these are they are suppose to last 50 hours of music time and 130 hours of battery time - we have not really timed it but I can say they last for ages before needed to be recharged. They have some really neat functions like the LED digital display, smart digital screen which shows the percentage of charge level. It all works via Bluetooth and really easy to set up even a child can do it. Everything you need comes in the box - you get 4 sets of silicone earplugs so have plenty of spares. I hate things with wires as they always seem to tangle up but with these you don’t need to worry about that, they are also waterproof and the sound quality is fantastic. My son said they are really comfortable and a lot of his friends have asked where they are from.

I’ve bought quite a lot of sets of headphones, earphones etc recently. I have expensive brands and cheaper brands and at 30 odd pound these fall into the cheaper category but that doesn’t tell the story of these earbuds at all. I bought these nearly a month ago and I’ve already had them taken off me by my brother who loves them. He normally wear beats but tried these and hasn’t looked back. They came delivered through Amazon Prime too so I got next day delivery as well which is great. First off they come in a case which also charges them when you put them in. Once the earbuds are in the case they automatically switch off charge. The battery life is great too. We always have music on as we both travel for work etc and the battery really does last a good amount of time. As I said I’ve got lots of different headphones etc and some of the cheaper ones don’t have great volume but these don’t have that problem at all. The volume is great and they obviously have the benefit of having no wires which is always better in my opinion. They are also so easy to connect to your phone simply find the Bluetooth device and connect it literally takes seconds. I’d happily use these all of the time they are light and don’t feel uncomfortable at all. Really good buy and overall based on price, appearance and quality I’d happily give these top marks.

I got this on a deal for under 30 euros and didn't have much expectations but it blew me away. Sound - The sound is full with enough bass. The bass doesn't feel cheap earphone bass, but rather something full and thick. Connectivity - Very simple and fast. Just take them out of the charging case and they connect automatically. No audio delay on netflix with my Laptop. My laptop only has BT 4.0 and yet these earbuds give you perfectly synced sound. Battery Life - I got it just today and have been watching netflix for 3 hours now on mid-loud audio. Features - The touch controls work flawlessly. Siri works great.

Ich habe diese Kopfhörer als Lösung für meine ständig verwickelten Kopfhörer gekauft, wenn ich von der Arbeit pendle und ich bin nicht enttäuscht. Es hat großartige Musik und einen tollen Klang. Die Isolation ist hervorragend, ich muss sie immer abschalten, um die Straße zu überqueren oder sie abzunehmen, wenn ich bequem mit Kollegen sprechen möchte. Das Mikrofon funktioniert relativ gut. Nur in wirklich ruhigen Situationen wird man geräuschlos gehört. Ich habe einige Schwierigkeiten, es auch zu benutzen, und wieder zu verbinden, wenn ich es ohne das Gehäuse abschalte, aber das ist nur eine Sache der Gewöhnung. Vorteile + sehr gutes Preis-Leistungs-Verhältnis + angenehm dynamischer Klang mit „Spaß-Faktor“ + leichtes und kleines Lade-Etui + Touch-Bedienung funktioniert gut + bequemer Sitz im Ohr Nachteile – Smartphone-App okay – Lade-Etui komplett aus Kunststoff – kein USB-C-Anschluss, sondern Mini-USB

Bought these for the missus to go jogging with as she was tired of wires and she had been stealing MY wireless headphones.....They pair up effortlessly with all our gadgets, phones, tablets, laptops etc. The first time I listened to them I wasn't blown away but then I realised the ear bud was too small for me, I swapped over to a larger profile ear bud ( you get 3 different sizes supplied) and wow what a difference! Deep bass and detailed crisp highs, lovely to sit back and enjoy music without getting tangled up. The battery pack is very handy as you can charge up devices from it as well as the earphones. The clarity of the audio during phone calls is fantastic too. For the price you can't go wrong!

🚚 SPEDIZIONE Come sempre, puntualissima mamma Amazon con le spedizioni, nulla da dire a riguardo 😁 📦IMBALLAGGIO e CONTENUTO Per l'imballaggio nulla da segnalare, arriva nella classica scatola di Amazon, è più che sufficiente Già a primo impatto, dalla scatola, si capisce che non abbiamo a che fare con le classiche cuffie economiche, hanno una bella scatola ben rifinita e elegante. All'interno troviamo istruzioni, un astuccino davvero molto utile (ma non è di quelli rigidi) un cavo microUSB per la ricarica, il ricambio di varie misure dei "gommini" delle cuffie e ovviamente la dock di ricarica delle cuffie dove all'interno ci sono le cuffie. Parliamo dalla dock di ricarica: è un power bank da 3500 mAh cosa che mi ha davvero stupito. Così piccolo, elegante e molto utile, perché ha una presa micro USB per la ricarica della stessa dock poi ha anche una porta USB per caricare il proprio telefono, come un classico powerbank. La dock ha anche un display dove mostra la percentuale di ricarica e la modalità di carica IN/OUT. Davvero molto figo il design. Le cuffie si portano all'orecchio molto bene pensano poco e non danno fastidio anche con uso prolungato. La connessione è abbastanza semplice, basta accendere il Bluetooth sul proprio smartphone e cercare il nome S9 ed il gioco è fatto. Io ho usato un OnePlus 5 e non ho avuto alcun problema. Non sono rimasto molto contento dei ricambi delle varie misure dei gommini. Sono totalmente diversi da quelli che ho trovato già montati sulle cuffie. 🔈 SUONO Il suono di per sè non è male, ma avendo un orecchio molto fine, siccome sono musicista, non posso che dare un commento semi-negativo siccome il suono si sente molto "tappato" il che fa capire che ha un range di frequenze molto minore rispetto alle cuffie classiche con connesione jack. Ho provato a sentire la differenza tra le due, e si sente parecchio la differenza di qualità. Può essere anche dovuto al fatto che la connessione Bluetooth non copre certe frequenze sia alte che basse facendo risultare il suono di poca qualità. Devo però dire che tutto sommato una persona che non ha l'orecchio così fine può anche non farci caso e rimanere comunque contento del prodotto. ✔️PRO - Eleganti - Comode - Dock di ricarica di dimensioni giustissime - Materiali di qualità ❌ CONTRO - Qualità del suono - Astuccino non rigido - (solo per me, credo) Gommini di ricambio IL MIO VOTO: 8/10

Great wireless earphones, great sound quality and battery life, only critism is that the spare silicon earpieces are not the same as the ones that come fixed to the earphone meaning that when I eat or talk with them in they sort of "pop" because the seal between my ear canal and the silicon is broken. If the silicon was replaced with the original design but in different sizes would be 5 stars

They are constantly disconnecting and the volume control doesn't work (some times they play songs at maximum volume). If you're on an iPhone ios13 (latest 13.1.2) please beware and avoid these earphones.

1. Bought those for my friend as a gift. 2. Tried them... 3. Want to keep them to myself! I'm really impressed with the quality of these earbuds. They are loud, stylish, have plenty of charge, have appealing design and great touch control features, they are really light and easy to setup. 5/5 will buy again.

Le casque est techniquement irréprochable pour son prix MAIS les grave sont trop présents et étouffent les mediums. Les hauts mediums et les aigus restent audible et sont clairs. Mon ancien casque Philips SHB5500 (au même prix à l'époque), à bien un meilleur rendu sonore (plus neutre). Il reste cependant utilisable pour regarder des films. Le chargeur n'est pas livré, ce qui n'est pas gênant pour moi et évite la prolifération de chargeurs inutiles. Un câble USB type A vers type C (très court) est fourni. Les +: * La led s'éteint quelques secondes après la connexion. Permet d'écouter la musique dans le noir sans être gêné. * Indique oralement son niveau de charge à l'allumage (en anglais). * Connecteur USB type C * Affichage du niveau de batterie sous Android ('Appels téléphoniques' doit être autorisé sous Android) * Fonctionne en AAC sous Android (testé sur Android 9) * Controle du volume hardware (Le curseur de contrôle du volume sous Windows se déplace) Les -: * Medium étouffés, grave qui fatigue un peu l'oreille. * Sensation de chaleur aux oreilles Codec A2DP supportés: --------------------- Codec SBC: - Sampling frequency: 16/32/44.1/48kHz - Channel mode: Mono/Dual channel/Stereo/Joint Stereo - Block length: 4/8/12/16 - Subbands: 4/8 - Allocation method: SNR/Loudness - Min/Max bitpool: 2/53 Codec MPEG-2 AAC LC: - Sampling frequency: 44.1/48kHz - Channels: 1/2

Utilisé à la fois pour écouter de la musique, téléphoner et sur PC (Skype, BigBlueButton, Discord, Zoom, etc.) je suis pleinement satisfait pour absolument toutes ces activités. Le son est vraiment excellent en écoute de musique (mais je ne suis pas un professionnel du son, seulement un amateur qui aime un bon son d'écoute) tout comme en mode téléphone ou communication Internet. En positionnant bien le casque sur les oreilles, celui-ci n'est pas du tout gênant, et le casque est tellement léger que même après plusieurs heures de port d'affilée, l'absence de mousse sur l'arceau n'est pas du tout gênante (même sur un crâne rasé comme le mien). Ce n'est pas un casque qui isole de l'extérieur, ce n'est pas le but des casque supra-auriculaire, mais il atténue bien les bruits extérieurs. Le micro intégré fonctionne vraiment très bien, le filtrage des sons parasites de machines (climatiseur, moteur, etc.) est excellent et les autres sons (voix, musique, etc.) sont très atténués pour ceux avec qui on communique. J'avais un doute à la lecture de commentaires parlant d'un écho de sa propre voix dans le micro, ce n'est pas le cas même si on s'entend effectivement ce qui n'est pas du tout gênant. Des options de configurations paramétrables et qui fonctionnent elles aussi surprenament bien sont accessibles selon l'appareil auquel le casque est connecté. Sous Windows 10, avec le driver Windows de base, dans les "Propriétés du périphérique supplémentaires" les options avancés de réglage du son peuvent être activées ou non (Super Basses, Ambiance, etc.) et également paramétrées (réglage de amplification des basses selon leur fréquence, ambiances Studio, Jazz hall et Concert qui ont un réelle efficacité, etc.). Les boutons sont facilement accessibles et semblent de bonne qualité. L'appairage est très rapide et sans problème. Il est possible d'appairer plusieurs appareils (téléphone et PC) et d'activer les fonctions (micro, son, etc.) pour l'un ou l'autre des appareils. La batterie a effectivement une durée de charge vraiment très impressionnante et l'annonce (en anglais) dans le casque du niveau de batterie lorsqu'on l'allume est très pratique (l'annonce de la connexion ou la déconnexion aux appareils appairés également). Je recommande à coup sûr.

Casque acheté pour mon fils autiste qui a du mal avec les écouteurs, il est parfait pour lui, simple à utiliser et confortable. Il s’appaire très bien avec son iPad. Le son est très bon pour un casque à ce prix. Le micro semble correct, je l’ai essayé moi même lors d’une conversation avec une amie au téléphone et elle m’entendait très bien. L’ensemble est léger et confortable. Il répond bien aux assistants vocaux (Siri en ce qui nous concerne). A voir dans le temps mais je suis très satisfaite de cet achat pour mon fils.

Lorsque j'ai commandé ce casque, je me demandais ce que cachait son prix modique. This is the first time I had been sent a product before it was publicly released in order to write a review, so I felt it only right to do a thorough product analysis. Below I have left a pros on cons list with explanations for each point. Pros: Sound - The sound is excellent, no two ways about it, no static, no hum and no muffling. It sounded sharp and clear for music, videos and telephone conversations. Microphone - This headset allows you to do hands free calls with it's built in, internal, microphone. Due to the microphone being inside the right ear drum I was worried that my voice would sound quiet but, according to the person on the other side of the phone, it doesn't sound any different from a normal phone call. Glasses - You'll have no problem wearing glasses while sporting the headset. It doesn't cause any pinching or squeezing. Light-weight - It's surprisingly light. Most wireless headsets have a bit of heft to them but, this one, I can imagine carry around without worrying about getting tired. Durable - With it's size and weight I was worried that it wouldn't be able to survive falling off someone head. So in order to find out I dropped it onto a hardwood floor from about 6 ft, twice, and was pleasantly surprised that not only did it survive but didn't have a mark on it. Cons: Little sound cancelling - It does very little to stop noise from escaping or entering. I found that while playing music the people around me could hear what I was playing if I had my volume at around 50%, I could also hear most things that were going on around me. Size - It's quite small, which can be a good thing, but I found the ear pads weren't able to cover my ears (Which may be while there's little sound cancelling). I had a female friend try them and she found that it was actually a tad too big, causing the pads to hang a bit low on her head. No head padding - Usually you'll find a pad on arch on the headset to add comfort, but not on this headset. I found the hard plastic very uncomfortable. However someone else I had wear the headset didn't mind the lack of pad, so I guess it'll depend on your head shape. Small charging cable - This is a small quibble but the charger that came in the box is remarkable small. It's a standard C charger port so this won't be a problem for most people. Overall it's not perfect, but for the current selling price of £50 I think you'll get more than your monies worth.

I have tried a multitude of headphones over the years everything from JVC, Sony, Sennheiser, Philips, WeSC to Grado, Bang & Olufsen and everything in-between. For my money, Grado makes the very best over-ear headphones I have ever bought and they also have exemplary after-sales service. I received these Sony headphones and they are the sixth Sony's I have tested. I have tested the 1000 M3's to a set which retailed over £200 which were designed for Hi Fidelity and now these. From the packaging to the actual product they are nice quality and the sound they produce, given the price, is very good. The big problem in rating headphones and earbuds is that the sound they produce and how they sound is very subjective to review, as two people can listen to a piece of music but they can hear that piece of music differently. In light of this, I am going to try and be as objective about these Earphones as I can. Let us start this review by considering the price, £49.99 at the time of review. This is a good price given the quality of what you are given. They are extremely well made. Everything from the box to the headpiece appears to be top quality., given the low price The headphones themselves are made of quality materials and are quite light. What is not good is that there is no cushioning on the headband. They are not that comfortable to wear over a long period, as I have a large head and need some cushioning. The sound they produce is very good given the price. The reproduction is rich and clear, the bass is fantastic, the middle range is clear and defined and the treble is delightful. The only downside to these phones is the bass, it just lacks a bit of depth. I was not expecting great things from these headphones, yet what they give you in terms of sound quality is very good, given the price. To summarise, these headphones are very well made and produce a sound that is very good. They offer value far beyond the price point. Where they are let down is in the noise-cancelling department. These phones are designed to be used on the go. The amount of background noise is, therefore, going to be loud. This set has no noise-cancelling system and so it kind of defeats the purpose of the set. You have to ask yourself, do you need NC as you journey around? If you don't need it, these are pretty good headphones for the price.

I wanted to wait a few weeks so I could give a fair review. I must say I am impressed with these headphones! To give a bit of background, these are the first set of wireless headphones I have owned. Previous to that I owned a pair of wired Sony headphones, similar to these. I love my music, and really enjoy listening to good quality sound. My initial impressions on the headphones are good. They feel very sturdy and I love how the ear cups twist so that the headphones can be stored flat in my rucksack. Connection to Bluetooth was very quick and easy, and I was able to start listening to Spotify on my phone within 2 minutes! After a full charge overnight, I was intreiged to see how long the headphones would actually last, given the advertised 35 hour battery life! Whilst I haven't kept a diary persay, as a minimum I use the headphones for at least 4 hours a day on my commute to and from work. Each time you turn the headphones on, you have a battery notice played to you, as well as a battery indicator shown on my phone. The headphones lasted for around 7 or 8 days before the headphones advised me to recharge. I haven't run the headphones right down flat, but I would say the 35 hour life is very accurate. These are on ear headphones so it would be unreasonable to expect complete noise cancelling. I wanted a pair of headphones that would not deaden my surroundings completely as I think it's important you aren't completely unaware. However I would say the headphones cancel noise enough to be able to hear the music. I occasionally use the headphones to make and receive telephone calls, both in the office at my desk and whilst commuting. The quality is fantastic, and I've not experienced any problems with the person on the other end not being able to hear me - big thumbs up for this feature! Thinking about the reviews I saw before buying these headphones, I will do my best to remember them and give my own thoughts. - The volume of the headphones are too low, even on the highest setting. I saw a few reviews saying this, both on amazon and a few other sources. I have personally not had any issues with the volume (or lack of) on these headphones. My music taste is varied, and even the softer genres play just fine for me. It may be worth noting that there are two volumes to adjust, your phone and the headphones themselves. Depending on the device you may also be able to adjust the graphic equaliser somewhat if needed. - The headphones are too tight on my head There has only been one occasion where I have experienced a bit of pain on my one ear, however I think they were ill-fitted as I adjusted them on my ears and they were fine thereafter. I would say I have an average sized head! I think you have to bear in mind that these headphones sit on your ears, so they will compress somewhat, so they stay on your head. I would not want them to be looser as I would be conscious they would slide around and potentially fall off my head. Some have suggested that the band itself is uncomfortable, again, I've not had any issues with this regard. All in all I think these are a really great set of headphones for the price. If your a more serious music listener then you may want to consider an alternative option, but I would consider these suitable for most!

The ratings I have given reflect the price, about £35. I am very pleased - bought them for listening to podcasts, making calls, and a bit of music. This is actually the second pair, the first had a very unstable bluetooth connection to my Huawei P9. The reference guide cautions against using it near wifi devices but wifi is everywhere now, and I have no problem with my Plantronics earpiece and other devices so I decided the first pair was faulty and sent it back. The replacement arrived the next day and proved me right - the second pair works perfectly. There is no noise cancellation but isolation is quite good, I can't hear my wife talking to me at all when listening to music. They are not the most hifi of headphones but at the price they are perfectly OK - natural, rather than boomy bass and not over bright. Just as well because I have found no way of adjusting anything but the volume on the headphone or the Huawei. Call quality is...good enough [EDIT: after 3 months use I would be less grudging - I have yet to have trouble hearing or being heard]. The first pair had poor microphone gain but I have had no complaints [after many] long calls on this second set. Not quite as precise as the £15 wired Sonys that this item replaces, but I ascribe that to the microphone being further from the mouth. It's just a little bit echoey, and one's own voice is delivered into the earpieces which was a bit odd for a minute or two but I seem to have got used to it now and don't notice. [EDIT: Since I wrote the above, and thanks to the BBC Rutherford & Fry podcast, I now know that this 'feedback' is just the deliberately engineered "sidetone", part of the purpose of which is to prevent people speaking too loudly on calls. I am completely accustomed to the headphones now and I am never aware of it]. I have read that the older CH500, available for a similar price from Amazon, has better call quality and is marginally better for music - but it is not quite as compact, nor does it charge as quickly or last as long - 20 rather than 35 hours per charge. Happy to recommend these. UPDATE. The battery life is indeed good. It typically three or four days, used for 2-3 hours each day, before the "full battery" message at switch on became approximately 70%". I recharged them anyway and continue to do so within a day or two of this alert. One caveat - I have an average sized bonce but I need very little extension on this headset. My wife's head is rather smaller, and in fact it is slightly too big for her at minimum size. If a standard baseball cap is too big for you, probably best look elsewhere.

Aus meiner Sicht hat der Kopfhörer nach ca. 1 Monat bei mir zu Hause eine Kaufempfehlung verdient. 5 Sterne. Bewerten und abbonieren macht glücklich. Vielen Dank fürs lesen und Viele Grüße Öz

These are some strange ones. I am hesitating between 4 and 5 stars, and when I started playing with these I initially thought that I'd give them only 3 stars as I immediately noticed a few issues (I have owned some 7-8 pairs of this type of headsets). But after testing them thoroughly and comparing sound quality with my other headsets, I concluded that they have a few superior features, mainly sound quality and comfort, that warrant 5 stars in spite of a few issues. So the sound quality is the best out of all my headsets, including some that are 50% more expensive now. They have a boomy bass (maybe even too boomy), but that can be reduced by slightly moving the earbud backwards (turning it in the ear, if you know what I mean). The higher frequencies are very pleasing and offer good reproduction of the sound. These headphones handled best one song that seemed to overpower other headphones with its loud sounds - these still sounded ok and pleasing. The volume is also quite high, so it's very satisfying. They are also very fast in connecting and disconnecting, however, there is this annoying design issue. When you place them back in the box, they immediately stop playing, but the phone thinks they are still playing and keeps sending them the stream, and they will not switch off until I close the box. This is annoying as an extra step to do. Also, I don't want them to connect to my phone and hijack the audio stream every time and open the box just to look at them - and they are really fast in connecting - only 2 seconds, so it's a world record almost - really fast. If only they did it only when I remove them from the box... Another thing is the cup - the medium size was too small for me, so I needed to use the largest size to enjoy the full sound quality, so someone with large ears has no recourse here. They sit well in the ears and are difficult to shake off with the hooks around the ears, however, to get the best sound quality I can only hook them a little bit - and further twist/turn to put them more behind the ears and all sound quality goes to ... somewhere else. Here are the pros: - great sound quality - great handling of loud sounds - super fast connecting and disconnecting - USB C (finally someone has done it!) - nice looking and soft touch case/box - two colours of ear hooks (I really like the bright green) - very comfortable if fitted properly in the right position - secure fit with comfortable soft hooks - internal volume control by holding the side buttons Cons: - buttons too hard to press (maybe they will wear in and become softer with time) - an annoying feature of switching on upon just opening the box - an annoying feature of not switching off until the box is closed - good sound quality only when hooks are hooked just a little bit over ears, so it's not super secure (but still quite secure - very difficult to shake them off) - the largest cup is actually medium, so most people will need to change and no recurse for people with large ear canals So all in all great sounding headphones with internal volume control and comfortable hooks, but annoying feature of connecting upon opening the box. Some people will be super happy with them while other super annoyed.

Where have these headphones been all my life? - I am a retired musician so i'm very very fussy about my music and how I listen to it, my current pair are quite good quality but the left ear bud keeps falling out no matter how I try to keep it in, I've tried different sizes of the small ear pieces that fit on but to no avail. I was looking to buy a new pair and came across these beauties! - the quality of the playback is exceptional, just enough bass and treble etc, they fit around my ears perfectly so will not keep falling out, even though my wife and I wear glasses they are still very comfortable to wear (See pictures) Very easy to use, simply turn on your bluetooth, look for G4 and you're up and running, couldn't be easier! Have yet to take them to the gym (the reason why I purchased them in the first place) but so far this is my impression: Fit - they fit very well with the rubber ear hooks not interfering with my glasses and the default medium size rubber ear-canal caps appear to be a perfect fit, sealing off the outside pretty well (this is the noise cancelation it talks of in the description). Make sure you try all three sizes when you get them because they have a significant effect on sound quality. The key is to make sure they seal the ear canal completely and then the quality really shines. They seem to be comfortable and shouldn't budge even under vigorous exercise to a point where they can be tricky to remove again. They also came with a neon yellow pair of ear hooks too. Sound quality - So far pretty decent, particularly for the price. They are bass heavy without distortion but it can overwhelm the mids however this seems to improved slightly after running them for about 20mins so it might improve once they wear in. They have a solid high end that doesn't sound tinny and overall deliver quite a wide sound stage. Deadmau5 "Some Chords" builds nicely and the bass kick can almost be felt. ELO's Living Thing on the other hand is a little disappointing, lacking sharpness in the drums but the vocals sit nicely and the instrument placement is good. Santana's "oye Como Va" shines, almost sounding like surround sound with the instruments and effects placed around the room. Bluetooth audio codecs appear to be limited to AAC (default) and SBC on my Note 9. Interface - Pretty simple physical rubberized buttons on each that take a fair push to click but work as advertised (single click to pause / play, double click (not overly sensitive how fast you click) to skip with the left ear clicking back and the right ear forward. Holding the button slowly turns the volume up (right ear) and down (left ear). Triple click launches your default voice assistant. Pairing - Easy to set up on my Note 9. Launch the bluetooth setting and hit scan open the lid of the case and wait a few seconds for "G4" to appear then just click pair and that is it. Supports HFP, HSP, A2DP and AVRCP. After use put the headphones back into the case (the snap in place with a satisfying action due to the magnetic restraint holding them in place) and close the lid. The next time just open the lid, and about 2secs later they are paired up and working. The Case itself is small and light with a rubberised texture and USB-C charging port (small cable included).

I bought these earbuds in one of amazons flashdeals when the comparative HolyHigh earbuds I initially plumped for arrived faulty (only one earbud worked) As such, I can provide a rudimentary comparison between the two brands for those it might be useful to. Frankly, the holyhighs I preferred aesthetically. The charger box seemed a little smaller, the earbuds packed more neatly together, and the earhooks were thicker and appeared less flimsey than these slimmer more flexible ones. I like 'sturdy!'. HOWEVER. The HolyHighs arrived faulty while the Muzili's arrived in perfect condition and bluetoothed to my mobile effortlessly. Initially they sounded a little bass heavy, but going into my mobile music settings and turning to 'reduced bass' (duh!) fixed the worst of the issue and they sound much better for my musical tastes (mostly classical, some pop/classic rock) now. I am not a techie, and was pretty surprised by how much the in-phone EQ settings did change the music, so for anyone not immediately thrilled with the sound, definitely give these settings a looksie before dismissing them. I also initially found the earbuds not especially comfortable and they made my inner ears somewhat 'tickly'. Switching to the smallest spare earbud covers did the trick for me. Noise cancellation is pretty decent. When 'he' listens to his godawful music on the hi-fi I can listen to my earbuds in the same room without hearing any jumble of sound. Which is nice. Its difficult to give an accurate sound comparison against the holyhighs, because of course I only had the one ear to listen through on them, but the sound appeared somewhat comparative. So negligible in my layman opinion as to not be a deciding factor either way. The earbud controls on the Muzili's felt much easier and more responsive than on the holyhighs. Thats handy, particularly for turning on and off on those many occasions when someone ('he' again) interrupts your music just for the sake of making their own voice heard. If the literature is anything to go by these earbuds take the lead in that they offer notably more listening time per charge. I have yet to explore this to its fullest but can confirm that I got 3 days intermittent use from them on a single charge with no signs of needing to charge imminently. Between rooms and floors (one floor) bluetooth does not provide much of an issue (a momentary cut-out of sound occasionally when you close the door between device and earphones but for me it has come back after that temperamental 'blip') but leaving the device inside while you go outside is a complete dealbreaker. I imagine this is common for all bluetooth devices of this budget, but I dont know from actual experience. This isnt a problem for me personally though, since I am never far away from my phone anyway. I'm just bored of getting tangled up in its wires. All in all, a very useful, uber portable little item for housework and blocking out the world. I bought them in a flash deal for around £31. They currently retail on amazon at around £38. I would be happy to pay either price for their functionality and would vote they ultimately trump the currently price comparative holyhighs for the more responsive operation buttons on the earbuds.

I've owned numerous earphones/headphones over the years and consider myself a bit of an audiophile. And while I'm by no means a professional, I'd like to think my experience counts for something. I already own a pair of working bluetooth earphones, but the skip track controls gave up the ghost, which is quite crucial for someone that cycles with their phone in their backpack and thus I felt an upgrade was due, so I bought these. And on first impressions these are actually very good by comparison. They're a bit more expensive than my previous pair, but I feel like the price increase was justified given what I'm getting in return. Out the box, you can tell that they haven't skipped out on materials. While the charge case is made of plastic, it by no means feels like it's going to fall apart the moment you accidentally breathe on it. Battery charge LEDs can be found on the front of the box and a USB Type C socket can be found at the rear, which is a god send if you love standardisation and hate the usual micro USB. The lid is hinged at one end and held in place with magnets at the opposing end, giving it a secure and solid feel when closed. Upon opening the case I was greeted with a very quiet "power on". And honestly I got a lot more excited about that than I should have done. It's a simple but very nice touch , meaning once paired to your phone (which was a pretty easy process), it's literally a case of whipping them out the case and slapping them in your ears without having to faff around with power switches. By contrast my last pair sometimes got possessed and would power off in the on position (they also seem to power off automatically after a few seconds when you put them back in the case). Speaking of slapping them in your ears, they're a very comfortable fit and they certainly don't feel like they're going to fall out. You could probably do a face first front flip over your handlebars, slide along the road for a bit and these things would still be playing graceful orchestral music in your ears throughout the duration... Unlike my last pair which ditched me the minute I left the ground. The buttons for play/pause, skip, etc. are nicely placed and have some nice feedback to them too. Everyone likes a good clicky button and they will satisfy that part of you. One thing to note is that these aren't capacitive touch control. A feature I specifically looked for because capacitive touch control in the rain with wet hands is generally, in my experience, abysmal to work with. Obviously, they come with large and small buds (on top of the preinstalled medium ones) which is to be expected, as well as a fluorescent green hooks in the event you don't like the preinstalled black ones. Again, a nice touch. Sound quality-wise, I honestly don't think you're going to do much better than these for the price range. And while they definitely won't replace my over-ear headphones, they do trump them in that I sadly can't wear my headphones with my bike helmet. I mean... I haven't tried, but I'm not sure I want to give off the cyberpunk teletubby vibe. Moving on, I listen to a lot of 80's rock, hair/glam Metal, the likes of Bon Jovi, Def Leppard, Motley Crue, etc. Because despite being in my early 20's I actually know what good music sounds like. The bass response is great for the form factor and the mid tones are just right for me. The treble is a bit on the sharp side for my personal taste (which is to be expected), but nothing a bit of EQ can't fix. Great sound for the form factor. Overall, I'm pleasantly surprised by these and I imagine you will be too.

Having seen so many apple fans walking arround with white airpods sticking out of each ear, and a fan of the sonic brilliance of a decent pair of 'cans', not to mention my being a clumsy idiot that loses stuff, I was more than a little skeptical about "true wireless" headphone (don't you just love marketing). So come Prime day and a pair of Soundpeats pop up for about £20 my interest peaked and my inner geek was tempted I ordered them, half expecting to be disappointed. And I was... Disappointed I hadn't bought them sooner! Sonically these are not replacing my sennheiser cans, but they are better than many wired in-ear headphones I have owned by far. Battery life is great, easily 4-5hours and the beauty of that recharge case means they are topped up each time you put them away. Genius. Sound quality.... I am using them with an android phone and an app called PowerAmp which I recommend. This app has a really good graphic equiliser function that can be configured individually and saved with profiles for different music types and even headphones via say headphone jack or bluetooth. So while they don't sound bad as they are, I can tailor the sound to suit my taste better using this app and as such if you find yourself not happy with the sound of these or any headphones give that a try. That said they are pretty decent sounding but For pure audio heaven look elsewhere.... On to use... They weigh alsmost nothing, incredibly light so no discomfort at all, the case also very light and easy to carry arround in jeans pocket and is barely noticeable. The touch controls work fine for me, and both earphones will individually annoumce connection. I have not experienced disconnects when the phone is less than 3m away Occasionally at 4m and cut off completely beyond 5-6 but bear in mind this likely has as much to do with your device / phone and what's between it and the headphones, eg walls, 5m and I'm in another room! They are as comfortable as typical in-ear headphones, no noticeable weight at all in fact you do notice the lack of cable drag / snagging that would occasionally yank out and ear bud when moving about which makes them very handy practically (for example - DIY tasks). I don't jog so can't comment on that. These are not noise cancelling to my knowledge but they do a damn good job of noise isolation. As I type this I can not hear a word of what my wife is saying to me :). Now... That are back at full price £30ish would I pay that knowing what I know now... Yes... I would to be honest.

in unserem Haushalt gab es bislang 3 entsprechende Geräte. Die teuersten von JBL für 120.-€ benutzt mein Sohn, ich begnügte mich beim Joggen mit günstigen Teilen vom Lidl und Ebay. Bei den Kabellosen Ohrhörern habe ich keine Schallübertragung über wackelnde Kabel beim Sport. Am prime day habe ich die Soundpeats bestellt, weil ich mit dem Sound meiner Billigteile nicht so ganz zufrieden war. Geliefert werden die Ohrhöhrer in eine Pappbox, darin die Ladebox und zusätzliche Ohrpassstücke sowie ein USB-Ladekabel, auch eine deutsche Bedienungsanleitung ist dabei. Die Ohrhörer schalten sich bei Entnahme aus der Ladebox automatisch ein, was ich sehr praktisch finde. Das Koppeln mit meinem Samsung S9 ging schnell und problemlos vonstatten. Die Ohrhöhrer sind sehr leicht und sitzen in meinen Ohren bequem aber fest, sie lösen sich nicht beim Joggen. Der Sound ist prima, kaum schlechter als bei den teuren JBL, so dass ich die Teile mittlerweile auch benutze, wenn ich Musik in Ruhe höre. Die Stärke des Basses hängt auch davon ab, wie tief ich die Teile in die Gehörgänge schiebe. Die Höhen kommen recht klar und unverfälscht. Einziges Manko ist, dass die Lautstärke nur über das Telefon und nicht direkt am Ohrhörer regelbar ist, so dass ich dann doch wieder zum Handy greifen muss, aus Jacken- oder Bauchtasche herausfummeln...Über die Laufzeit mit einer Akkuladung kann ich noch nichts schreiben, da ich sie nur für jeweils eine Stunde am Stück nutze. Ob sie 2 oder 4 Stunden laufen, ist mir persönlich für meine Zwecke egal. Fazit: Für den günstigen Preis eine echte Empfehlung, ich würde die Soundpeats wieder kaufen.

Beim Gespräch ist es ein wenig leise, aber hab es noch nicht all zu oft getestet (kann also an meinem Gesprächspartner liegen) und auch daran, dass ich nur 1 Kopfhörer beim reden verwendet habe. FEATURES: Die Kopfhörer gehen von alleine aus und an sobald diese in der Box sind bzw. herausgenommen werden. Die Kopfhörer gehen auch automatisch an, sobald man diese sich ins Ohr steckt. Die koppeln sich auch gegenseitig sehr schnell wenn man z.b. nur 1 verwendet hatte und dann den zweiten anmacht! Man kann mit dem Touch "Knopf" pausieren, weiter machen, Gespräche annehmen und auflegen. Das einzige "Manko" - man kann am Kopfhörer nicht lauter und leiser stellen. Aber das geht glaub bei allen Kopfhörern dieser Sorte nicht. TRAGEKOMFORT: Finde die Kopfhörer sehr bequem.. Nach 1 Stunde tragen hat man diese irgendwann im Ohr gemerkt, aber ich finde sie trotzdem sehr angenehm vom Tragekomfort her. INSGESAMT: Mega Kopfhörer für den Preis!
